title: Survival Putonghua for International Students
requirements: Not for students who have taken CLCP/CPTH1133 or above
description: A non-credit-bearing basic Putonghua course designed for non-native Chinese speakers, including exchange and international full-time students, who use Chinese as a second/foreign language and are looking for survival skills in Putonghua. The course is structured to help students communicate orally with Chinese people in Putonghua in different scenarios, with student-centred, proficiency-oriented activities based on useful daily expressions and basic vocabulary items. It focuses on student's oral skills. Real-life settings are introduced, such as shopping, introduction of family members, asking for directions, etc.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO1: for levels 1-2) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a very limited number of immediate needs. (S&L1) understand and reply to utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammar points at the sentence level in daily conversations  學生於完成本科時預期能： （學習成果：第一級和第二級）有限度地使用普通話作簡短問答以應付日常生活中的基本需求。  (S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中的簡短對話並作出回應
syllabus: CLCP1000 is a non-credit-bearing Putonghua course for non-native Chinese speakers. Lesson topics include but are not limited to: an introduction to the sounds and tones of Putonghua and the pinyin Romanization system, greetings and self-introductions, asking for directions and the location of buildings, ordering food, shopping and bargaining, making appointments, calling a friend, and CUHK-specific items, such as faculty, department, and college names, common job titles, landmarks and major buildings on campus, and campus facilities (i.e. dormitories, supermarkets, the health clinic, canteens, etc.).
required_readings: Textbook chapters and supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

Students are introduced to the sound structure and writing system of Putonghua. Chinese characters are taught and required. Lesson topics include but are not limited to: giving one’s name and nationality, giving simple locations of buildings, discussing daily activities, deciding on where to eat, asking for the price of something, telling time and making simple plans, and making a phone call.

title: Elementary Putonghua
requirements: Not for students who have taken LEDC3520, CLED3530, or CLCP/CPTH2703 or above. Students are not allowed to take two levels of Putonghua in one term. Placement needed before registration.

title: Pragmatic Internship in China (PRINCH, Advanced Level)
requirements: Pre-requisite:;1. An advanced course for students who have completed CLCP3703, CPTH3703 or above. ;2. For students who have not completed the above course, they are invited to join the Putonghua placement offered by CLC.
description: PRINCH is a task-based course designed to provide advanced level students with the opportunity to use language in real life for real communication purposes. It allows students to practice what they have learned in class through a variety of activities in the target culture, focusing on topics related to social, political and economic issue. Class format consists of three parts: 1) Pre-trip activities with teachers; 2) Theme-based trip in small groups led by teachers or teaching assistants; and 3) Post-trip tasks with teachers, such as Q&A, discussion and presentation.
